description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR/SIDE EXTENSION; FULL WIDTH EXTENSION TO THE MAIN REAR ROOF: AND INSTALLATION OF A/C UNIT AT ROOF LEVEL
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 
Site Location Plan
P2
P4
P5
Air conditioning unit specification

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form, approved drawings and planning statement unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - Due to potential impact on the surrounding locality from the development, the criteria from the acoustic assessment to protect noise impact on the surrounding noise sensitive properties as specified in the Architectural Services Group, Noise Assessment Report ASG-1664-NAR'01' November 2023, shall be maintained as a minimum standard.  

Reason:  To protect the amenities of the occupiers in the local vicinity.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
   iv) The application was considered by the Planning Committee where the applicant/agent had the opportunity to speak to the committee and promote the application.
